programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: North Texas (27-8) held on to beat Oklahoma State, 61-59, behind 15 points from Atin Wright; UC Irvine (31-6) went to overtime to defeat UAB, 81-77, behind 22 points and 11 rebounds from Devin Tillis, along with 18 points from Bent Leuchten.

programme.title: High School Basketball
programme.desc: Duke signees Cameron and Cayden Boozer, the sons of former NBA player Carlos Boozer lead the East against the West, which is led by BYU signee AJ Dybantsa, the No. 1 2025 recruit, and Kansas signee Darryn Peterson, in the annual showcase game.

programme.desc: Kentucky has claimed victories over Louisville in their last four consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on March 29, 2023, with a 7-4 scoreline; Erin Coffel posted a game-best 3 RBIs for the Wildcats in the win at home.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 8-ranked LSU is 9-4 all-time against No. 9-ranked Oklahoma after earning a 5-4 victory at the 2022 Shriners Hospitals for Children College Classic at Minute Maid Park in Houston, as Jordan Thompson hit a solo HR in the bottom of the 11th inning.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula One drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: Scott Van Pelt and Stanford Steve delve into the rigors of the sports betting world by reliving some of the recent bad beats in recent games, from a last-second shot ruining the line to an over-under being erased due to scoring sprees or droughts.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Featured first-round welterweight bouts: Jason Jackson vs. Andrey Koreshkov; Magomed Umalatov vs. Logan Storley; Mukhamed Berkhamov vs. Florim Zendeli; featured featherweight bouts: Jesus Pinedo vs. Adam Borics; Jeremy Kennedy vs. Movlid Khaybulaev.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Colorado (14-20) plays in its 13th postseason in 14 possible years under Tad Boyle; Villanova (19-14) went 11-9 in Big East play behind Eric Dixon, who led the country in scoring with 23 ppg, and faces the Buffaloes for the first time since 1999.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Colorado (14-20) plays in its 13th postseason in 14 possible years under Tad Boyle; Villanova (19-14) went 11-9 in Big East play behind Eric Dixon, who led the country in scoring with 23 ppg, and faces the Buffaloes for the first time since 1999.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Tulane (19-14) makes its first postseason appearance since the 2014 CIT; USC (16-17) used an efficient offense to record ranked wins over Michigan State and Illinois during the season, and face the Green Wave for the first time in program history.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Tulane (19-14) makes its first postseason appearance since the 2014 CIT; USC (16-17) used an efficient offense to record ranked wins over Michigan State and Illinois during the season, and face the Green Wave for the first time in program history.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra Pregame
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming College Basketball Crown game, breaking down the key players to watch on both teams who could determine the outcome, the latest news and what the two teams will need to do in order to come away with a win.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: MotoGP

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Colorado (14-20) plays in its 13th postseason in 14 possible years under Tad Boyle; Villanova (19-14) went 11-9 in Big East play behind Eric Dixon, who led the country in scoring with 23 ppg, and faces the Buffaloes for the first time since 1999.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Tulane (19-14) makes its first postseason appearance since the 2014 CIT; USC (16-17) used an efficient offense to record ranked wins over Michigan State and Illinois during the season, and face the Green Wave for the first time in program history.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Dunkerque is coming off of a 2-0 defeat to Bastia in Ligue 2 on March 28 where they conceded goals to Christophe Vincent and Maxime Blé; Paris SG claimed a 6-1 victory against Saint-Étienne in Ligue 1 on March 29, led by a Désiré Doué brace.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres UANL has reached the final four times since its runner-up finish in the 2015-16 edition; LA Galaxy, the winner of the 2000 tournament, defeated Herediano, 4-1, on March 12 to advance; inaugural meeting between the two clubs.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Oregon State (20-12) reached the 20-win plateau in the regular season for the first time since 1989-90 behind All-WCC First Team Michael Rataj; UCF (17-16) makes its third-straight postseason appearance and fifth under Johnny Dawkins.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Women's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Qadsiah claimed victories against Al-Raed in both of their meetings from the league, winning the final matchup on Feb. 6 with a 2-0 scoreline; Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang found the net and assisted Julián Quiñones in the win at home.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Cruz Azul defeated Seattle on aggregate in the Round of 16, 4-1; Club América is unbeaten in eight of the past 10 meetings across all competitions after a 4-3 victory on Dec. 8, as Rodrigo Aguirre scored the game-winner in second-half stoppage time.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Women's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: DePaul (14-19) makes its first postseason appearance since advancing to the finals of the 2019 CBI; Cincinnati (18-15) earned its 47th postseason berth in program history, and faces the Blue Demons since the two were Big East foes in 2013.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas UNAM won the inaugural edition against the Whitecaps with a 2-0 victory on the road in the Round of 32 of the 2024 Leagues Cup, as César Huerta and Jorge Ruvalcaba scored; Vancouver advanced past Monterrey on away goals in the Round of 16.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.
